meanings.definition: The action or process of making something normal or standard again.
meanings.sent1: After the chaos, the renormalization of the classroom brought back order and routine.
meanings.sent2: The renormalization of the temperature in the room made it comfortable for everyone.
meanings.sent3: The renormalization of the messy desk made it look brand new.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude acted as a renormalization for the team, bringing back harmony.
meanings.sent5: The renormalization of the garden transformed it into a peaceful sanctuary.

meanings.definition: The process of adjusting or correcting a mathematical model to account for certain factors.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use renormalization to refine their mathematical models and make them more accurate.
meanings.sent2: The renormalization of the equation accounted for the missing variables.
meanings.sent3: The renormalization of the budget spreadsheet was like solving a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: His ability to simplify complex problems was like a renormalization of the entire project.
meanings.sent5: The renormalization of the data set revealed hidden patterns and trends.
